Name: FileRead
Description: You can easily retrieve your project's original/translated resource file from our backend by making a GET request to /file/read/.

Parameters.desc: File identifier (string). May contain special characters, recommended maximum length is 255 characters.
Language id (int). The human language of the content. E.g. 1 = English (GB), 11 = Finnish. Please refer to /languages/-method for full list of language ids.
Authentication token which can be acquired with valid transfluent.com account credentials using authenticate-method

Returns.Other: Attention! Exceptionally this method won't response with a JSON package. It will set 'Content-Disposition: attachment; filename=..' HTTP header and force your client to download the file.

Name: FileSave
Description: You can easily save your project's resource file to our backend by making a POST request to /file/save/.

Parameters.desc:
Supported formats are:- UTF-8, UTF-16. UTF-8 should be used for everything except iOS .strings files. 
They are UTF-16 encoded and the format parameter must be specified as UTF-16 for them.
File content must be base64 encoded.
Supported types are:- iOS-strings, Android-strings, Android-arrays, MooTools-locale, js-file, Symbian-TS, WP-RESX, Properties-file, YAML-file, XML-file, po-file, Excel-file, json-file
If you have previously translated content, you may save the translations by specifying this variable as true (1;on). Remember to use the same file identifier as the source file has.
File identifier (string). May contain special characters, recommended maximum length is 255 characters.
Language id (int). The human language of the content. E.g. 1 = English (GB), 11 = Finnish. Please refer to /languages/-method for full list of language ids.
Authentication token which can be acquired with valid transfluent.com account credentials using authenticate-method

Name: FileTranslate
Description: You can easily translate texts from your project's resource file by making a POST request to /file/translate/. Please note that previously translated, unchanged items won't be re-translated. All new and changed items will be translated.

Parameters.desc:
A POST request with a JSON payload will be sent to callback URL. It will contain an array of links to updated files. The array is indexed by language ids. Example callback payload:
{"updated_files":{"4":"https:\/\/transfluent.com\/v2\/file\/read\/?token=foobar123&identifier=my-project-Localizable.strings&language=4"}}
Comment to the translator. E.g. context information, requested text style (formal/informal) etc.

Target languages to translate file content into. Provide language ids as an JSON-array (JSON: [1,4,11]) or use post fields (target_languages[]=1&target_languages[]=4&target_languages[]=11). E.g. 1 = English (GB), 11 = Finnish. 
Please refer to /languages/-method for full list of language ids.
Translator level: expert (#7), business translation with proof-reading (#3), business translation (#2), economy translation (#7) or a native/student translator (#1)
File identifier (string). May contain special characters, recommended maximum length is 255 characters.

Language id (int). The human language of the content. E.g. 1 = English (GB), 11 = Finnish. 
Please refer to /languages/-method for full list of language ids.
Authentication token which can be acquired with valid transfluent.com account credentials using authenticate-method
When set to true (quote=1), a quote will be returned instead of processing the payload and placing the order.
